Wellington restaurant Mabel’s to close days after award-winning bakery Myrtle https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/wellington-restaurant-mabels-to-close-days-after-award-writing-bakery-myrtle/V72PJLPBSVDYHIWWCTC3HHGMBQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/wellington-restaurant-mabels-to-close-days-after-award-writing-bakery-myrtle/V72PJLPBSVDYHIWWCTC3HHGMBQ/ Georgina CampbellOwners say they have missed their children terribly after working so many nights. Gisborne unveils water filtration unit for emergencies https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-unveils-water-filter-unit-for-emergcies/Y6HJY75DVNCEZCDPCQSNK6QIVA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-unveils-water-filter-unit-for-emergcies/Y6HJY75DVNCEZCDPCQSNK6QIVA/ Zita Campbell, Local Democracy ReporterThe portable water unit can supply fresh water in mass during severe weather events. Mon, 09 Dec 2024 04:00:00 +0000 A new water filtration being deployed by Tairawhiti Emergency Management (Temo) group is the first of its kind worldwide. Pictured at a Temo demonstration day at Gisborne's inner harbour on Friday are (from left) LEDI systems engineer Rhys McCormack, Emergency Management and Recovery Minister Mark Mitchell, Temo group manager Ben Green, LEDI founder and engineer Dael Liddicoat and National Emergency Management Agency chief executive Dave Gawn. Photo / Zita Campbell

Mon, 09 Dec 2024 03:58:42 +0000 Firefighters are responding to a large vegetation fire near West Melton in Canterbury tonight. Photo / Isy Arambasic.

Prime Minister Christopher Luxon announces shake-up of banking sector to improve competition at post-Cabinet press conference https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-finance-minister-nicola-willis-to-front-post-cabinet-press-conference/P2WOYJHQFFDHRGCSO5WQEKED2Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-finance-minister-nicola-willis-to-front-post-cabinet-press-conference/P2WOYJHQFFDHRGCSO5WQEKED2Q/ Christopher Luxon: ‘In short, we want to disrupt the status quo.’ Mon, 09 Dec 2024 03:20:14 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon (right) and Finance Minister Nicola Willis have announced changes in the banking sector at the post-Cabinet press conference. Former Auckland pharmacist Murad Al Gailani fails to thwart conviction for $50,000 Unichem theft https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/former-auckland-pharmacist-murad-al-gailani-fails-to-thwart-conviction-for-50000-unichem-theft/SHHTBUJW25EMLEL4DNQY7WQAR4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/former-auckland-pharmacist-murad-al-gailani-fails-to-thwart-conviction-for-50000-unichem-theft/SHHTBUJW25EMLEL4DNQY7WQAR4/ Craig KapitanA conviction might make it more difficult to attend pharmacist conferences, he said. Mon, 09 Dec 2024 03:08:43 +0000 Pharmacist Murad Al Gailani has pleaded guilty to embezzling nearly $50,000 from an Auckland Unichem. He asked for a discharge without conviction, arguing that a criminal record would hinder his career prospects in Australia. Photo / Supplied
